author: Michael J Kavanagh, Natalia Drozdiak, Joe Deaux
description: Negotiators from Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo agreed to a US-backed regional economic framework after weeks of delay, according to Rwanda’s government spokeswoman, a move that the Trump administration considers a crucial step to bolstering a sputtering peace deal.
title: Rwanda and Congo Agree to US-Backed Economic Deal After Delays

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump said that no US officials would attend the Group of 20 conference later this month in South Africa, the latest escalation in the rift that has erupted over his claims that the country is mistreating White Afrikaners.
title: Trump Says US Plans to Skip G-20 Summit in South Africa

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The president so far has been staying out of direct negotiations.
title: Trump Stays the Course on the Shutdown as Pressure Points Mount

author: Patricia Hurtado, David Voreacos
description: The US Justice Department urged a New York state appeals court to reverse Donald Trump’s felony conviction, an extraordinary intervention by federal officials as the president seeks to clear his criminal record.
title: DOJ Urges NY Appeals Court to Reverse Trump Criminal Conviction

author: Zoltan Simon, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US President Donald Trump granted Hungary an exemption from sanctions on purchases of Russian oil, providing a major win for Prime Minister Viktor Orban.
title: Trump Grants Hungary Exemption on Russian Oil in Orban Win

author: Josh Wingrove, Ilena Peng
description: President Donald Trump asked the Justice Department to start an investigation into the meatpacking industry, accusing them of “driving up the price of Beef through Illicit Collusion, Price Fixing, and Price Manipulation.”
title: Trump Asks Justice Department to Probe Meatpackers on Prices

author: Peyton Forte, Janet Freund
description: As the US government shutdown stretches further into November and threatens holiday spending, one casualty of the budget impasse feared to hit sales of major grocers and their suppliers: the delay of monthly federal food assistance.
title: Wall Street Sounds Alarm on SNAP Cuts Amid Peak Shopping Season

author: Josh Wingrove
description: Trump administration officials are dismissing the idea of a financial backstop for artificial intelligence companies, US officials said, after comments from a top OpenAI executive raised questions about the prospects for a federal bailout.
title: Trump Administration Rules Out AI Backstop Amid OpenAI Uproar

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump is granting a pardon to former baseball star Darryl Strawberry, who pleaded guilty three decades ago to tax evasion, according to a White House official.
title: Trump Pardons Mets Legend Darryl Strawberry Over Tax Evasion

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis
description: Senate Republicans on Friday rejected Democrats’ offer to scale back their shutdown demands to a one-year extension of expiring health care subsidies, prolonging a stalemate that has disrupted air travel and delayed food aid.
title: Republicans Reject Shutdown Offer as Travel, Food Aid Delays Hit

author: Anthony Capaccio, Roxana Tiron
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth challenged Pentagon contractors to speed up weapons development or “fade away” in a speech Friday before an audience of executives from major industry players and newer entrants such as Anduril Industries Inc.
title: Hegseth Demands Companies Speed Weapons Development or Fade Away

author: Allyson Versprille
description: Flight reductions in the US could escalate to as much as 20% if the ongoing government shutdown leads to worsening air traffic control staffing, Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said on Fox News.
title: US Flight Cuts Could Reach 20% If Situation Worsens, Duffy Says

author: Oscar Medina
description: Colombia’s finance ministry is shelving a proposal to impose a withholding tax on digital payments, following a backlash from industry groups and businesses.
title: Colombia Shelves Digital Payments Tax Plan After Backlash

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukraine is fighting a rearguard action to prevent Russia gaining its biggest victory in almost two years, an advance that also demonstrates the battlefield challenges facing Vladimir Putin’s army.
title: Ukraine Digs In to Try to Halt Biggest Russian Win in Two Years

author: Jason Gale, Kendall Taggart, Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: The US State Department has prepared templates for new bilateral health agreements that would give Washington expanded oversight of disease surveillance, outbreak reporting and data sharing in partner countries, according to documents reviewed by Bloomberg News .
title: State Department Plans New Framework to Advance America First Global Health Strategy

author: Kate Sullivan, Josh Wingrove
description: US President Donald Trump signaled an openness to exempting Hungary from sanctions on purchases of Russian energy as he hosted Prime Minister Viktor Orban.
title: Trump Lauds Orban, ‘Looking At’ Russian Sanctions Exemption

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: The European Union and China agreed to join Brazil in a coalition aimed at improving collaboration on carbon markets — one of the main innovations the South American nation is bringing to the COP30 climate summit.
title: EU, China Said to Join Brazil-Led Carbon Market Coalition

author: Arne Delfs
description: Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof said China has agreed to resume deliveries of Nexperia chips from plants in the country, signaling a potential breakthrough in a clash that risked disrupting global auto production.
title: China to Resume Nexperia Chip Exports, Dutch PM Schoof Says

author: Bailey Lipschultz
description: Less than one year into Donald Trump’s second term and the post-election ebullience has evaporated from shares of his social media company as sales stagnate and profitability remains elusive.
title: Trump Media Stock Slump Deepens as Election Bump Erased, Losses Mount

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Emma Sanchez
description: New York State regulators approved a key permit for Williams Cos. to build a natural gas pipeline to serve New York City.
title: New York Approves Williams Pipeline to Bring Gas to NYC

author: Pablo Mayo Cerqueiro, Swetha Gopinath, Annie Massa
description: ASP Isotopes Inc.’s uranium-enriching arm is offering convertible notes in a deal that has drawn the backing of investors including Eric Trump and Donald Trump Jr.
title: Trump Sons Back ASPI’s Uranium Unit QLE in Convertible Note Sale

author: Liam Knox, Greg Ryan
description: Cornell University said Friday it had reached an agreement with the White House to restore about $250 million in federal funding, becoming the latest elite school to negotiate relief in response to the Trump administration’s campaign to remake higher education.
title: Cornell Strikes Deal With White House to Restore Funding

author: Sam Dagher, Khalid Al Ansary
description: Iraq’s Prime Minister Mohammed Shia Al-Sudani vowed to undertake major reforms if elected for a second term, aiming to cut the budget deficit, boost private-sector employment and attract more foreign direct investment to the oil-rich country.
title: Iraqi PM Says He’ll Reshape Economy If He Wins Second Term

author: Erik Larson
description: The Trump administration asked an appeals court to pause a judge’s order requiring the US to fully fund November food-aid benefits to 42 million eligible Americans by Friday, arguing the government shutdown has left only enough money for partial payments.
title: Trump Officials Seek Pause in Judge’s Food-Aid Benefits Order

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Senate Democrats are pressing Fiserv Inc. for information on the role former chief executive Frank Bisignano played in the company’s plummeting fortunes before he took a role in President Donald Trump’s administration.
title: Democrats Probe Trump Social Security Chief’s Tie to Fiserv Fall

author: Baudelaire Mieu, Katarina Hoije
description: Two of the world’s largest shipping companies, MSC Mediterranean Shipping Co SA and CMA CGM SA, have suspended service to Mali over security and fueling concerns.
title: Major Shippers Halt Mali Service Over Insecurity, Fuel Shortage

author: Maria Eloisa Capurro
description: Americans’ perceptions of the job market worsened in October while their expectations for inflation edged lower, according to a monthly survey from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.
title: US Consumers See Worse Job Market, Muted Inflation in Fed Survey

author: Ari Natter
description: The Trump administration plans to auction offshore drilling rights across roughly half of the Gulf of Mexico next month, the first of 30 such lease sales in the area.
title: Trump to Auction Oil, Gas Drilling Rights Across Gulf Next Month

author: Helen Nyambura
description: Tanzania charged scores of people with treason for their alleged involvement in deadly protests that erupted after the east African nation’s contentious elections last week.
title: Tanzania Charges Scores of People With Treason Over Protests

author: Jim Wyss
description: International travel to Cuba is tumbling, putting the cash-strapped communist island on track for its worst showing since the pandemic.
title: Tourism to Cuba Plunges as It Reels From Shortages and Sanctions

author: Mark Schroers, Jana Randow
description: Europe should consider measures against China if trade ties with the Asian nation continue to deteriorate, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel.
title: Europe Should Mull China Action If Situation Worsens, Nagel Says

author: Misha Savic
description: Serbia’s lawmakers voted to speed up preparations for a divisive real estate project in the capital backed by Jared Kushner, son-in-law of US President Donald Trump.
title: Serbia Passes Law to Fast-Track Planned Trump Tower in Belgrade

author: Vinicius Andrade
description: As Javier Milei prepares to meet with investors in New York on Friday, fund giant Pacific Investment Management Co. has a clear message for the Argentine president: Let the peso float freely.
title: Pimco Urges Milei to Let the Peso Float While ‘Times Are Good’

author: Carter Johnson, Alice Atkins
description: The longest US government shutdown in record is consigning currency traders to their worst year in decades as a dearth of economic data clouds the outlook for the dollar.
title: US Shutdown Compounds Worst Year for Currency Trading Since 2005

author: Megan Durisin Albery
description: China has lifted its suspension on soybean purchases from three American suppliers, further easing tensions over agricultural trade between between Beijing and Washington.
title: China Renews Soybean Imports From US Firms After Trade Summit

author: Foster Wong
description: China suspended its sweeping controls on its exports of rare earths and other critical materials until November 2026 as part of its trade truce with the US.
title: China Formalizes Rare Earth Curbs Suspension After Trade Truce

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukrainian military intelligence, known as HUR, said its drones hit the Sterlitamak Petrochemical Plant in Russia’s Bashkortostan region, according to a statement on Telegram.
title: Ukraine Says Drones Hit Petrochemical Plant in Russia’s Urals

author: Benjamin Penn
description: The South Florida US attorney’s office is recruiting prosecutors and restructuring its chain of command in preparation for a grand jury investigation expected to target former Justice Department officials and others involved in cases against President Donald Trump.
title: DOJ Miami Office Readies Conspiracy Probe Into Trump Enemies

author: Anusha Ondaatjie
description: Sri Lanka President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, presenting the nation’s 2026 budget, pledged reforms to keep a $3 billion International Monetary Fund bailout on track and announced measures to attract investments for sustaining the economy’s recovery from a historic default.
title: Sri Lanka Budget Aims Investment, Reforms to Protect IMF Bailout

author: Joe Mayes
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has submitted her major tax-and-spend plans to the UK’s independent Office for Budget Responsibility, a key moment ahead of her set-piece budget on Nov. 26.
title: Reeves Puts Tax-Raising Budget Plans to Watchdog for Verdict

author: Maria Eloisa Capurro, Molly Smith
description: Federal Reserve officials had to make their latest interest-rate decision without key economic statistics thanks to the US government shutdown. The data they will receive when the government reopens probably won’t make the next decision any easier.
title: Fed’s December Rate Decision Won’t Come Easy, Even if Shutdown Ends Soon

author: Laura Millan
description: Talks over the next two weeks in Brazil might just show the US as increasingly isolated.
title: COP30 Summit Contends With Trump’s Disdain for Climate Change

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Monica Raymunt, William Wilkes
description: China is allowing Dutch chipmaker Nexperia to export again, setting the stage for the Netherlands to suspend its powers over the Chinese-owned company.
title: Nexperia Spat Eases as Chip Flows Open Door to Dutch Reversal

author: James Woolcock
description: A UK minister urged King Charles III’s brother, Andrew Mountbatten Windsor, to cooperate with a US congressional panel that’s investigating the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s sex-trafficking ring.
title: UK Minister Urges Former Prince Andrew to Help US Epstein Probe

author: James Attwood, Sergio Mendoza
description: Bolivia is awash in the battery metal lithium, but the resource is nearly all trapped underground.
title: Bolivia Is Rethinking Lithium Deals with China, Russia in US Pivot

author: Paul Wallace
description: Israel launched some of its heaviest airstrikes on Lebanon since it agreed to a ceasefire with the Iran-backed militant group Hezbollah around a year ago.
title: Israel Escalates Lebanon Strikes as Tensions With Hezbollah Rise

author: Rene Vollgraaff
description: Former South African Finance Minister Malusi Gigaba will appear in court on Friday to face charges related to corruption that allegedly occurred during his tenure as minister of public enterprises, according to a statement from his office.
title: South Africa’s Former Finance Minister Gigaba to Face Charges

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Alberto Nardelli
description: The Netherlands is prepared to suspend a so-called ministerial order that gave it control over Chinese-owned chipmaker Nexperia in a move that would de-escalate a fight with Beijing that threatens to disrupt automotive production around the world.
title: Dutch Ready to Drop Nexperia Control If Chip Supply Resumes

author: Lucille Liu
description: As US-China relations lurch between escalation and detente, some local American officials are pursuing their own diplomacy to secure access to the world’s second-largest market.
title: US States Seek Own China Ties as Trade Uncertainty Persists

author: Josh Xiao
description: China’s largest and most advanced warship has officially entered its military fleet, boosting Beijing’s ability to project naval power amid rising US concern about its assertiveness in the Indo-Pacific.
title: China’s Top Aircraft Carrier Begins Service in Boost to Beijing

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Viktor Orban expected a political boon and a flood of investments after Donald Trump was re-elected to the US presidency. A year later, the Hungarian prime minister is going to the White House with cap in hand.
title: Orban Dangles Energy Deals to Sway Trump on Russia Oil Sanctions

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea fired a ballistic missile off its east coast, South Korea’s military said on Friday, a day after Pyongyang bristled at US sanctions imposed on some of its bankers that Washington accused of laundering funds.
title: North Korea Fires Ballistic Missile, South Korea Says

author: Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: The US Treasury Department has opened an investigation into $9 billion in “preference-based contracting,” including the awarding of Small Business Administration funds.
title: Treasury Opens Fraud Probe on $9 Billion in Small Business Aid

author: Lauren Dezenski, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Uzbekistan will invest more than $100 billion in the US over the next decade, President Donald Trump said.
title: Trump Says Uzbekistan to Invest More Than $100 Billion in US

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan and the US will join forces to extract rare earths in the waters around a small island in the Pacific, after the two allies struck an agreement to work together to cut their reliance on China for the critical mineral.
title: Japan, US to Join Forces to Mine Rare Earths Near Pacific Island

author: Philip Heijmans
description: The US lifted its arms embargo on Cambodia, the latest sign of Washington’s renewed engagement with the Southeast Asian nation after it backed President Donald Trump’s peace accord with Thailand.
title: US Lifts Cambodia Arms Embargo After Trump-Backed Ceasefire

author: Magdalena Del Valle, Nariman Gizitdinov, Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump said he would look to diversify critical minerals purchases during a meeting with five central Asian countries on Thursday, as the US seeks to address China’s dominance in rare earths critical to advanced technology manufacturing.
title: Trump Seeks Rare Earths in Meeting With Central Asian Nations

author: Thomas Seal, Nojoud Al Mallees
description: Canada’s Conservative Party lost its second member of Parliament in a week, putting pressure on Pierre Poilievre, the main political rival of Prime Minister Mark Carney.
title: Carney’s Conservative Rival Loses Second Lawmaker in Three Days
